ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name
Notes: e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version

ElementDescription: Relationship of respondent to individual
Notes: 1 = Biological mom; 2 = Biological dad; 3 = Grandparent; 4 = Special education (sped) teacher; 5 = General education teacher; 6 = Occupational therapist; 7 = Speech and language therapist; 8 = Behavioral therapist; 9 = Paraprofessional; 10 = Aide; 11 = Principal; 12 = Administrator; 14 = Content teacher; 15 = Parent center director; 16 = Self; 17 = Adoptive mother; 18 = Adoptive father; 19 = Foster mother; 20 = Foster father; 21 = Grandmother; 22 = Grandfather; 23 = Step-mother; 24 = Step-father; 25 = Aunt; 26 = Uncle; 28 = Both parents; 31 = Grandmother from mother side; 32 = Grandfather from mother side; 33 = Grandmother from father side; 57 = Summary; 58 = Counselor; 59 = Other female relative; 60 = Other male relative; 61 = Non-relative ; 62 = Maternal Aunt; 63 = Maternal Uncle; 64 = Maternal Cousin; 65 = Paternal Aunt; 66 = Paternal Uncle; 67 = Paternal Cousin; 68 = Biological/Adoptive Mother and Grandmother; 69 = Biological/Adoptive Mother and Stepmother and Grandmother; 70 = Biological/Adoptive Mother and Grandmother and Foster Father; 71 = Biological/Adoptive Mother and Stepmother and Foster Mother; 72 = Biological/Adoptive Mother and Foster Mother; 73 = Biological/Adoptive Mother and Biological/Adoptive Father; 74 = Biological/Adoptive Mother and Stepmother and Biological/Adoptive Father; 75 = Biological/Adoptive Mother and Other; 76 = Biological/Adoptive Mother and Stepmother and Stepfather; 77 = Biological/Adoptive Mother and Stepfather; 78 = Biological/Adoptive Mother and Grandfather; ElementDescription: Parent: 1. I make my child feel better after he/she worries. / Child: Makes me feel better after I talk over my worries
Parent: 2. I like to talk to my child and be with him/her much of the time. / Child: Likes to talk to me and be with me much of the time
Parent: 3. I am easy with my child. / Child: Is easy with me
Parent: 4. I see my child's good points more than his/her faults. / Child: Seems to see my good points more than my faults
Parent: 5. I feel hurt when my child doesn't follow my advice. / Child: Feels hurt when I don't follow his/her advice
Parent: 6. I usually find out about my child's bad behavior. / Child: Usually finds out about my bad behavior

Parent: 7. I worry about how my child will turn out when he/she grows up because I take anything he/she does seriously. / Child: Worries about how I will turn out when I grow up because he/she takes anything bad I do seriously
Parent: 8. I almost always speak to my child with a warm and friendly voice. / Child: Almost always speaks to me with a warm and friendly voice
Parent: 9. I am always thinking of things that will make my child happy. / Child: Is always thinking of things that will make me happy
Parent: 10. I let my child off easy when he/she does something wrong. / Child: Let's me off easy when I do something wrong
Parent: 11. I understand my child's problems and worries. / Child: Understands my problems and my worries
Parent: 12. My child thinks I don't appreciate him/her when  he/she does something wrong. / Child: Thinks I don't appreciate him/her when I don't obey
Parent: 13. I don't pay much attention to my child's bad behavior. / Child: Doesn't pay much attention to my bad behavior
Parent: 14. I don't trust my child again for a long time if he/she breaks a promise. / Child: Doesn't trust me again for a long time if I break a promise
Parent: 15. I enjoy talking things over with my child. / Child: Enjoys talking things over with me
Parent: 16. I give my child a lot of care and attention. / Child: Gives me a lot of care and attention
Parent: 17. I say yes to anything my child wants. / Child: Says yes to anything I want
Parent: 18. I enjoy going on drives, trips, or visits with my child. / Child: Enjoys going on drives, trips, or visits with me
Parent: 19. I feel hurt by the bad things my child does. / Child: Feels hurt by the bad things I do
Parent: 20. I make my child do his/her homework. / Child: Makes me do my homework
Parent: 21. I say someday when my child grows up he/she will be punished for the bad things he/she does now. / Child: Says some day when I grow up I'll be punished for the bad things I do now
Parent: 22. I smile at my child very often. / Child: Smiles at me very often
Parent: 23. I often give something up in order to get something for my child. / Child: Often gives up something in order to get something for me
Parent: 24. I excuse the bad things my child does. / Child: Excuses the bad things I do
Parent: 25. I make my child feel better when he/she is upset. / Child: Makes me feel better when I am upset
Parent: 26. I tell my child how much I have suffered for him/her. / Child: Tells me how much he/she has suffered for me
Parent: 27. I check up to see whether my child has done what he/she was told to do. / Child: Checks up to see whether I have done what I was told to do
Parent: 28. I think and talk about my child's bad behavior long after it is over. / Child: Thinks and talks about my bad behavior long after it is over
Parent: 29. I enjoy doing things with my child. / Child: Enjoys doing things with me
Parent: 30. I make my child feel like the most important person in my life. / Child: Makes me feel like the most important person in his/her life
Parent: 31. I let my child stay up late if he/she keeps asking. / Child: Let's me stay up late if I keep asking
Parent: 32. I enjoy working with my child in the house or yard. / Child: Enjoys working with me in the house or yard
Parent: 33. I say if my child loved me, he/she would do what I want him/her to do. / Child: Says if I loved him/her, I'd do what he/she wants me to do
Parent: 34. I insist that my child do things I want him/her to do. / Child: Insists that I do things he/she wants me to do
Parent: 35. I say that someday my child will be sorry that he/she wasn't better as a child. / Child: Says that someday I'll be sorry that I wasn't better as a child
Parent: 36. I comfort my child when he/she is afraid. / Child: Comforts me when I'm afraid
Parent: 37. I enjoy staying home with my child more than going out with friends. / Child: Enjoys staying at home with me more than going out with friends
Parent: 38. I make sure my child obeys even if he/she complains or protests. / Child: Makes sure I obey even if I complain or protest
Parent: 39. I cheer my child up when he/she is sad. / Child: Cheers me up when I am sad
Parent: 40. I tell my child all of the things I have done for him/her. / Child: Tells me of all the things he/she has done for me
Parent: 41. I make sure that my child follows my rules. / Child: Makes sure that I follow his/her rules
Parent: 42. I think that any bad behavior is serious and will affect my child's life when he/she grows up. / Child: Thinks that any bad behavior is very serious and will affect my life when I grow up
Parent: 43. I often speak of the good things my child does. / Child: Often speaks of the good things I do
Parent: 44. I make my whole life center around the children. / Child: Makes his/her whole life center about the children
Parent: 45. My child can talk me out of an order if he/she complains. / Child: Let's me talk him/her out of an order if I complain
Parent: 46. I have a good time at home with my child. / Child: Has a good time at home with me
Parent: 47. I say if my child really cared for me, he/she would not do things that make me worry. / Child: Says if I really cared for him/her I would not do things that make him/her worry
Parent: 48. I let my child get away with not doing work he/she is supposed to do. / Child: Lets me get away without doing work I am supposed to do
Parent: 49. I say that sooner or later we always pay for bad behavior. / Child: Says that sooner or later we always pay for bad behavior
Parent: 50. I am proud of the things my child does. / Child: Seems proud of the things I do
Parent: 51. I spend almost all of my free time with the children. / Child: Spends almost all of his/her free time with the children
Parent: 52. I can be talked into things easily. / Child: Can be talked into things easily
Parent: 53. I'm not interested in changing my child, but like him/her as he/she is. / Child: Isn't interested in changing me but likes me as I am
Parent: 54. I say my child doesn't appreciate all I have done for him/her when he/she doesn't do as told. / Child: Says I don't appreciate all he/she has done for me when I don't do as told
Parent: 55. I let my child get away with a lot of things. / Child: Lets me get away with a lot of things
Parent: 56. I will talk to my child again and again about anything bad he/she does. / Child: Will talk to me again and again about anything bad I do

Parent: 57. I am always telling my child how they should behave. / Child: Is always telling me how I should behave
Parent: 58. I would like to be able to tell my child what to do all the time. / Child: Would like to be able to tell me what to do all the time
Parent: 59. I want to control whatever my child does. / Child: Wants to control whatever I do
Parent: 60. I am always trying to change my child. / Child: Is always trying to change me

66. Parent: I give my child as much freedom as he/she wants. / Child: Gives me as much freedom as I want
67. Parent: I believe in showing my child my love for him/her. / Child: Believes in showing their love for me

69. Parent: I let my child go out any evening he/she wants. / Child: lets me go out any evening I want
70. Parent: I let my child do anything he/she likes to do. / Child: Lets me do anything I would like to do
71: Parent: I am a caregiver who believes in having a lot of rules and sticking with them / Child: My parent / caregiver is a person who believes in having a lot of rules and sticking with them
72: Parent: I am a caregiver who insists that my child must do exactly as they are told / Child: My parent / caregiver insists that I do exactly as I am told
73: Parent: I am a caregiver who is very strict with my child / Child: My parent / caregiver is very strict with me
74: Parent: I am a caregiver who often praises my child / Child: My parent / caregiver often praises me
